title: 10-year-old with Aspergers pens crushing poem about being different
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Everyone wants to fit in, to feel like they belong. But finding a group that accepts you for who you are can be one of life’s greatest challenges. That’s why the internet is loving this poem written by a 10-year-old boy with Aspergers. 
When he was assigned to write an “I Am” poem for school, Benjamin wrote a heartfelt piece about how he feels “odd.” 2 
Here’s the full poem: 
“I am odd, I am new 
I wonder if you are too 
I hear voices in the air 
I see you don’t, and that’s not fair 
I want to not feel blue 
I am odd, I am new 
I pretend that you are too 
I feel like a boy in outerspace 
I touch the stars and feel out of place 
I worry what others might think 
I cry when people laugh, it makes me shrink 
I am odd, I am new 
I understand now that so are you 
I say, “I feel like a castaway” 
I dream of a day that that’s okay 
I try to fit in 
I hope that someday I do 
I am odd, I am new” 
The internet was touched by Benjamin’s beautiful words, sharing the post over 36,000 times. People were quick to remind him that everyone in this world is odd — that’s what makes life interesting. 4
